body_html: Have you tried running the benchmark_model binary with your model? The python bindings are good for prototyping but the best performance check for inference time is benchmark_model. On Aug 19, 2017 12:07 AM, "Matt Feury" <notifications@github.com> wrote: hey all, first off thanks for all the work here. I've been struggling to get TF setup on my Pi A+ (armv6), but with the recent work in #12190 <#12190>, i was able to build, install, and run TF. sweet! i was curious what type of benchmarks others were seeing though. I am running (through Keras) a very basic predict on a somewhat small CNN, and I am seeing anywhere from 10-40s predict times (not including loading the model, imports, etc). This seems extremely high to me consider switching the Keras backend to Theano causes predictions to stick around 5s. Is there perhaps someway to optimize the installation? I've tried overclocking and shrinking/expanding gpu memory, but everything is still 10+. As far as I know, it can't leverage the GPU but my next step is to try building the wheel with gpu support. — You are receiving this because you were assigned. Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub <#5729 (comment)>, or mute the thread <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/ABtim7odRybLFXkJbW-3MSuEaGfHedepks5sZom3gaJpZM4K3eBk> .
body_text:
Have you tried running the benchmark_model binary with your model?  The
python bindings are good for prototyping but the best performance check for
inference time is benchmark_model.

On Aug 19, 2017 12:07 AM, "Matt Feury" <notifications@github.com> wrote:

hey all,

first off thanks for all the work here. I've been struggling to get TF
setup on my Pi A+ (armv6), but with the recent work in #12190
<#12190>, i was able to build,
install, and run TF. sweet!

i was curious what type of benchmarks others were seeing though. I am
running (through Keras) a very basic predict on a somewhat small CNN, and I
am seeing anywhere from 10-40s predict times (not including loading the
model, imports, etc). This seems extremely high to me consider switching
the Keras backend to Theano causes predictions to stick around 5s.

Is there perhaps someway to optimize the installation? I've tried
overclocking and shrinking/expanding gpu memory, but everything is still
10+. As far as I know, it can't leverage the GPU but my next step is to try
building the wheel with gpu support.

—
You are receiving this because you were assigned.
Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub

body:
Have you tried running the benchmark_model binary with your model?  The
python bindings are good for prototyping but the best performance check for
inference time is benchmark_model.

On Aug 19, 2017 12:07 AM, "Matt Feury" <notifications@github.com> wrote:

hey all,

first off thanks for all the work here. I've been struggling to get TF
setup on my Pi A+ (armv6), but with the recent work in #12190
<https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/pull/12190>, i was able to build,
install, and run TF. sweet!

i was curious what type of benchmarks others were seeing though. I am
running (through Keras) a very basic predict on a somewhat small CNN, and I
am seeing anywhere from 10-40s predict times (not including loading the
model, imports, etc). This seems extremely high to me consider switching
the Keras backend to Theano causes predictions to stick around 5s.

Is there perhaps someway to optimize the installation? I've tried
overclocking and shrinking/expanding gpu memory, but everything is still
10+. As far as I know, it can't leverage the GPU but my next step is to try
building the wheel with gpu support.

—
You are receiving this because you were assigned.
